title: Why were native Americans helpful to the original pilgrims? - Quora
tags: History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: In Massachusetts the Wampanoag confederation was being dominated by the Narrangansett tribe in Rhode Island. Massaoit the chief of the Wampanoag saw that the Pilgrims had guns & yet they were about to starve. So he sent Squanto the last surviving member of the Patuxet village to help the Pilgrims how to plant corn. He showed them to plant a few seeds with a fish to fertilize the soil. So the Pilgrims allied with the Wampanoag against the Narrangansetts.

They thought they were gods until death(killing) of Santiago. They watched for 7 days to see if he would come back to life. By this time, though, their fate was sealed. Death from immune system failures caused the natives to die by the thousands, coupled with 10s of thousands added to that from wars, famine, and genocide fostered by the European exploiting tribal, cultural, and linguistical differences.
